Description: Wooden shabti-box, lid missing, pylon-shaped, with polychrome painted decoration representing funerary deities. Base is composed of reused painted fragments of one or more boxes of the same type. Each long side of the box has symmetrically-placed holes, probably for the attachment of carrying-poles.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. Tillier, 'Portable chests for the falcon cults of Akhmim, MDAIK 72 (2016), 239-51.
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
